This notebook contains useful functions for the rest of the scripts.

{% endraw %}

Code timing

{% raw %}

class timecode[source]

timecode()

This class is used for timing code

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
with timecode() as t: 
    time.sleep(1)
print(t.t)

with timecode() as t: 
    x = [0,1,2,3,4]
    y = [o+1 for o in x]
print(t.t)

1.001036524772644
2.946704626083374e-06
{% endraw %}

GPU profiling

{% raw %}

print_device_info[source]

print_device_info()

Prints some statistics around versions and the GPU's available for the host machine

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

dump_tensors[source]

dump_tensors(gpu_only=True)

Prints a list of the Tensors being tracked by the garbage collector. Useful when running into an out of memory error on the GPU.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Monitor[source]

Monitor(delay) :: Thread

Use this to check that you are using the GPU during your pytorch functions and to track memory usage of the GPU's as well.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

show_gpu[source]

show_gpu(msg)

ref: https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/issues/1742#issue-518262673 put in logger.info()

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Tensor utils

{% raw %}

round_t[source]

round_t(t, dp=2)

Return rounded tensors for easy viewing. t is a tensor, dp=decimal places

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
round_t(torch.rand((10,2)))

array([[0.63, 0.99],
       [0.35, 0.64],
       [0.94, 0.83],
       [0.86, 0.16],
       [0.92, 0.41],
       [0.01, 0.72],
       [0.57, 0.63],
       [0.11, 0.33],
       [0.19, 0.57],
       [0.26, 0.95]], dtype=float32)
{% endraw %}
